attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4’10” or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Cancel plans to open a trading office in Raleigh North Carolina
attributes.background: Recently North Carolina has passed a bill dubbed 'HB 2' which has "voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights". As a result many business ventures have removed or cancelled their investment plans in the state. The UK should also refuse to support a region that legalises LGBT discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: "North Carolina has lost a string of big investment ventures over Governor Pat McCrory’s decision to sign the contentious HB 2 – which voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights, banned transgender people from using their preferred bathroom, and permits businesses to discriminate against LGBT people on the grounds of religious belief" http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/07/26/uk-government-to-open-trade-hub-in-north-carolina-despite-controversy-over-anti-lgbt-law/

attributes.action: Organise a Great Exhibition
attributes.background: Trade Delegations from all over the World coming to see what Britain has to offer in all its diversity. Every aspect of Britain and British Life can be represented, and as well as the trade Deals we can make, think of the tremendous impact on Tourism from people coming from all over the World.
attributes.additional_details:
Those Britons who worked so hard on our behalf for the Olympics as Ambassadors can welcome overseas visitors, show people around and generally be involved. 
British Royalty is revered and respected all over the World, and they can take part as did Prince Albert for the 1851 Exhibition.
We can find a way for every person in the UK to have a personal investment in this project, engendering a feeling of pride and ownership in Project Great Britain.

attributes.action: Stop the monitoring of benefits spending.
attributes.background: Benefit payments are a lifeline. These payments are funded by the public as an insurance against misfortune. The monitoring of these subsistence payments is a gross misuse of public money and an abuse of the public trust. People are entitled to spend their benefits as they choose.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.thecanary.co/2016/07/13/snooping-on-benefit-recipients-spending-and-is-totally-legal-with-this-phone-app/

attributes.action: Make welfare forms easier to understand for people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: As a young adult with a learning disability and autism. i have found that most forms that are used by local councils and the DWP are in a format that many people with a learning disability will struggle to understand and process them leading applicants to get anxious and reluctant to apply.
attributes.additional_details: When corresponding the information. the letters and forms don't always specify what you need to send off, and the way the questions are phrased or relayed a person with a disabilitiy wont understand what is in front of them or will struggle look at all information, so the councils and dwp need to make all official documents learning disability friendly

attributes.action: Schools to have the funding for a full time teaching assistant in every class.
attributes.background: To ensure that every child is supported in their education, every primary school should have the funding to employ a full time teaching assistant in every class. This would not be to fulfil administrative tasks but to support the learning of all children.

attributes.action: Ensure all future national referendums need more than 50% of electorate to pass
attributes.background: 37% of the electorate took the decision for UK to leave the EU. I believe this to be anti-democratic.
attributes.additional_details:
A minority of the electorate should not be able to take the country in a new direction. 

If an issue is so important it requires a national  referendum,  then to change the status quo it should be able to get more than 50% of the entire electorate,  regardless of turnout. If it cannot get 50% of the entire electorate it should be deemed to have failed.

attributes.action: Give the right to vote to EU citizens having lived in the UK for 5 years or more
attributes.background: EU residents, who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more, have the right to get UK citizenship. However many people do not exercise this option for various reasons and, consequently, they do not have the right to vote. Brexit referendum has shown risks deriving from the lack of this voting right
attributes.additional_details: EU residents are net contributors to the UK economy and represent a crucial asset for the sustainable development of this country. Giving voting rights to EU residents who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more would mean the recognition of a fair right and would allow EU residents to have their say on topics that have a direct impact on their lives (such as the recent EU referendum)

attributes.action: Give weapons to Ukraine to defend herself from Russian hybrid war
attributes.background: The level of Russian aggression is rising just as our once formidable ability (back in the cold war ) to counter them seems to have vanished altogether. Instead, we have trouble simply recognizing them for what they are.
attributes.additional_details: Ukraine gave up its nuclear weapons in exchange for the grantee from the United Kingdom that they will protect the Ukrainian nation from invasion. The Budapest Memorandum on Security Assurances signed in Budapest, Hungary on 5 December 1994, providing security assurances by its signatories relating to Ukraine's accession to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. The Memorandum was signed by USA and the United Kingdom..  It is time to honor the spirit of the agreement..

attributes.action: Grant all those who have finished Secondary education the ability to vote.
attributes.background: By the end of secondary education, people have to decide where next to go in there life, whether it be further education, an apprenticeship or full time employment. At this age, people make life changing decisions about there own life. Why shouldn't they have a say in there country's life?
attributes.additional_details:
Year groups at college are split, as some people are too young to vote. Some people who are slightly too young to vote have to deal with other people's decisions until they are, in some cases, 22 years old. 
Some people can go through life with just there secondary education, and still have the ability to vote. So it cannot be argued that, in this case, with only a secondary education, teenagers do not have the mental capability to vote. 
We should allow young people to shape there future.

attributes.action: Introduce a direct democracy which gives power back to citizens
attributes.background: Direct democracy allows any citizen to challenge any law approved by the parliament or, at any time, propose a modification of the federal Constitution. Switzerlands direct democracy holds referendums to decide on new and current legislation. Its time to bring democracy back to the UK.

attributes.action: Social Services should have to voice record all meetings and visits.
attributes.background: Social services often try to put those who attend meetings with them off when it come to recording meetings. Their code of conduct explains they should be open and honest so I question why they will not do this. It would help to avoid disputes over what was said and ensure clarity for documentation
attributes.additional_details:
Social services documents are well known for being inaccurate and falsified. If you notify social services you wish to record all meetings they take extreme exception however if they were to note down events accurately surely this would just be another form of evidence.
Social services having to record means they cannot deny knowledge of events, or be accused of recording inaccurately as there will be evidence of what was said. It also can act as a form of reference to ensure reports reflect events.

attributes.action: Change mandatory jail sentence for rape, rather than community service.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the jail sentence length and to rule out community service. The victims of these charges deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Two women under 16 were raped by a man aged 17 (now 18) and he got off with 18 months community service. He put these two girls and their families through hell and he basically got away with it. What is community service going to do to help these two girls go about their lives without having to keep looking over there shoulders. How does having an unstable mind allow this man to not get jail time.

attributes.action: Ban domesticated cats from being allowed to roam freely outdoors
attributes.background:
In 2014 there were estimated to be 8 million cats in Britain
It isn't natural for there to be 8 million cats roaming around this land. 
Cats kill 55 million birds a year, millions of other animals too, spread fleas, deficate on other peoples property and get ran over and cause accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.pfma.org.uk/pet-population-2014
http://www.rspb.org.uk/makeahomeforwildlife/advice/gardening/unwantedvisitors/cats/birddeclines.aspx
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-19353/Cats-kill-275-million-animals-year.html

attributes.action: Strip the regulatory bodies of their charitable status
attributes.background: Health care professionals allied to medicine in the National Health Service are regulated by their regulatory bodies to protect the public. Many are charities. Being charities they have deprived the taxman of money. They can bring about poverty as they do not allocate their charitable funds equally.
attributes.additional_details:
They don't allocate funds equally.

If you are subject to proceedings the prosecution has a a huge untapped fund which is not available to the defendant. Their defence bodies defend may not defend you so you may have to fund this yourself. You may struggle to get work until the conclusion, guilty or not. If found guilty you can't get work in anything compounding poverty. At the appeal they have that unlimited pool the defendant does not and then may have costs awarded compounding poverty.

attributes.action: Allow HM forces and government employees overseas to access British TV online
attributes.background:
Currently HM Forces Troops and government personnel based overseas are unable to access UK television online due to location restrictions.  

It is proposed that eligible personnel be allowed to purchase a UK TV licence which would give them access privileges to online services.

attributes.action: Change the way in which property is bought and sold in England
attributes.background: My family and I have recently been left in a bad position, because of a supposedly reliable cash buyer pulling out of purchasing our flat, a week before we were going to be moving into our newly built family home.
attributes.additional_details: I would like a legally binding contract in place at an earlier stage (for example when a price is agreed) during the property buying and selling process. This will give the seller the confidence to start spending money on their next purchase, and not be worrying about if the buyer is going to back out. If a buyer then backs out without good reason then they will be liable for all the costs that the seller has incurred, and the buyer should also lose their deposit.

attributes.action: Improve CAMHS services in Cumbria, especially surrounding eating disorders.
attributes.background: There is a huge lack of resources and staff within Cumbria CAMHS, having just one dietitician in the entire county. The team regularly allows patients suffering from eating disorders to get so severe they require inpatient treatment hundreds of miles away.There are no specialists and a lack of care.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS stands for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, and this is where children and teenagers up to the age of 18 get support and therapy for their mental illnesses. 
There are NO specialist eating disorder services within the whole county; the closest being Middlesborough, which I am currently staying as an inpatient with severe Anorexia Nervosa for the second time due to the immense lack of support and understanding in Cumbria. This is a 2 and a half hour journey. 
This is not fair.

attributes.action: Put and end to UK circuses using animals as part of their 'performances'.
attributes.background: Along with you I feel it is extremely necessary to put an end to the abusive, cruel and unorthodox ways in which animals are treated in order to 'perform' to an audience. Awareness for this issue is preposterously inadequate and a lot more action against this compulsory to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
One case study to get a taste of the happens that are kept away from the public is Anne the elephant: 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1370050/Britains-circus-elephant-Anne-Battered-kicked-stabbed.html 

These animals are put through a life of pain for a number of hours worth of entertainment, surely everybody can see the imbalance in this.

attributes.action: Grant British citizenship to all settled EU nationals in UK
attributes.background: Most EU nationals who are setteled in UK, made UK their home, have mortgages, pay taxes and their kids attend schools across Britain are feared that after UK left EU their right to live and work in UK will be ceased and this will have a detremental impact on their life!

attributes.action: Condemn the Xenophobia of UK Tabloids and Ensure EU Free Movement Continues.
attributes.background: We call on MPs to condemn incitement by our tabloid press against foreigners and enact laws making it an offence. We call for a relationship with Europe that allows free movement from the EU so talented business people, scientists, academics, skilled workers & engineers feel welcome & not hated.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/jul/11/police-blame-worst-rise-in-recorded-hate-on-eu-referendum. 
http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=50675#.V4YqavkrLmE
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/brexit-britain-latest-news-academics-threaten-to-quit-brain-drain-over-racist-xenophobic-eu-a7133316.html
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/brexitvote/2016/06/29/letter-to-mps-from-a-remain-voter-a-plea-for-realism-tolerance-and-honesty/
http://nyti.ms/29H7OnH

attributes.action: Education should be Free. Scrap University fees. Scrap & write off student loans
attributes.background:
Education is a right. It should be more accessible to everyone regardless of their backgrounds. Without Education society can never prosper.

Student loans should also be scrapped or written off. They charge too much interest.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/may/17/george-osborne-pledge-to-scrap-very-unfair-tuition-fees-comes-to-light

attributes.action: Introduce a radical overhaul of British football’s development of youth talent.
attributes.background: We call on Tracey Crouch MP (minister of Sport) and the government, to implement a German-style ‘Extended Talent Promotion Programme’ within British football. We need a similar radical overhaul of how we coach youth football, how we structure our youth development, and how we nurture young talent.

attributes.action: Any new Prime Minister must have the confidence of the people and Parliament
attributes.background: We call for the Fixed-term Parliaments Act to be amended such that any new Prime Minister’s government must face an explicit vote of confidence in the Commons. If no government can win such a vote, a general election must be held.
attributes.additional_details:
After the EU Referendum result and the Prime Minister’s resignation, Parliament must show confidence in the Government or call a general election.

 The Government and any new Prime Minister have no mandate for post-referendum negotiations. The exceptional circumstances and political division require a new mandate.

 Petitions cannot call for a vote of No Confidence, nor for the dissolution of Parliament, but they can ask for an amendment to legislation such as the Fixed-term Parliaments Act.

attributes.action: Stop the UK Government leaving the EU without consent from Scottish Parliament.
attributes.background:
Brexit politicians misled millions of voters on immigration, funding, the NHS, and the economic impact of leaving the EU.

We the undersigned call on David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon to ensure the views of the Scottish people are represented and cease the process of leading the UK out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland has to agree to the UK leaving the EU in order for Brexit to go ahead. A second referendum is extremely unlikely. The best chance we have of stopping the UK proceeding with leaving the EU is for the Scottish Parliament to refuse to give formal legislative consent.

attributes.action: Prevent this divided UK referendum catastrophe from ever happening again.
attributes.background:
No matter which way we voted in the Brexit referendum, we all woke up to a UK where massive economic, political, and social changes in our collective futures were enacted by 51.9% of the voting public and 50% of nation's in the UK. 

Please reform how we do this to avoid it ever happening again.
attributes.additional_details:
We now must deal with the uncertainty wrought by a narrow victory and the division created by having two nations impose their will on two others. 

Once this Europe mess is sorted, we propose the next referendum subject be answered in less divisive manner:

First it must be passed by both Houses of Parliament, that's what they're for.

Then it must gain a majority of voters, which must also total at least 50% of all registered voters.

It must also get a majority in each of our four nations.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election by May 2017 to ensure UK not governed by unelected PM
attributes.background: During the referendum the Leave campaign continually stressed that a key issue was not wanting to be governed by unelected representatives (even though EU has elected MEPs). Therefore, now there is such key work to be done, we must have a nationally elected Prime Minister, not a nominated one.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament needs to act to call a General Election before May 2017 to ensure that key decisions are taken with a true mandate. As part of this, no action should be taken by any interim prime minister to activate Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty.

attributes.action: Change the law so that cowboy trades people are prosecuted in a criminal court
attributes.background: People save hard to have construction work done at there property, only to hire a trades person who stops work half way through a job leaving the home owner with an unfinished property and thousands of pounds out of pocket. This should be considered a criminal offence as county court is no deterrent
attributes.additional_details: Rogue trades people are often taken to county court by home owners when a trades person does not complete the work he/she has been contracted to complete. If the home owner wins the case the trades person will have a county court judgement which the home owner will then have to enforce if the trades person does not pay. This still does not guarantee that the home owner will receive any money. County court judgements are no deterrent to a trades person that has no assets that can be seized.

attributes.action: Control immigration to prevent overpopulation and economic depression
attributes.background: Immigration is becoming a big issue in Europe and even bigger in the UK. With current immigration levels the UK is on the path to extreme overpopulation which could mean even more strain on services such as the NHS, Housing, public transportation and almost all other public services will be affected
attributes.additional_details:
The guardian on overpopulation in Britain: http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/feb/09/is-britain-full-home-truths-about-population-panic
Top 10 overpopulated countries (including UK(3rd party)):
http://www.newstatesman.com/blogs/the-staggers/2010/07/population-index-overpopulated
Overpopulation is clearly a highly likely event in the UK unless the government is blind to see the high population increase in the UK then they should be doing more to delay it or prevent it.

attributes.action: Make History a mandatory Core subject which can't be dropped
attributes.background: History is a subject which has enormous value. It teaches us the successes and errors which have happened in the past so we can learn from. At this current point in time children are not appreciating what their ancestors did for them and how Society has been shaped by historical actions.

attributes.action: 2 years Jnr armed forces training should count towards your pensionable service.
attributes.background:
I want the uk government to recognize armed forces training as a junior from 16 to 18 should count towards your pensionable service.
Any other industry would recognize your employment at 16 from day one.
This affects your pension as a working serviceman or woman in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I joined the Army as a 16 year old soldier & spent 2 years training.
Then completed 9 years colour service, then 1 year open engagement.
The government only recognise 9 years colour service as this technically the contract i signed. 
In business where service is recognised, where else would you have 3 years not rewarded in any way, especially as those are the years I spent learning my trade.
My pension has been devalued by 3 years because the government will only pay for my contracted period of 9.

attributes.action:
Make it illegal for UK private nurseries to charge parents for 
Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Private nurseries in the UK charge parents for every Bank Holiday in the UK (8 in total) but the nursery remains closed. This can cost parents in excess over £1,000 PER CHILD before a child turns school age. Parents are paying for a service that is not provided and does not exist.

attributes.action: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda
attributes.background: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda, publicly supporting ISIS or  getting people to join ISIS.

attributes.action: Make edible ring holders compulsory for the protection of marine and wildlife.
attributes.background: Saltwater Brewery in Florida invented a 100% biodegradable, edible 6-pack ring holder using brewing waste products such as barley and wheat. I call on the government to legislate, or at least incentivise the introduction of edible ring holders to replace dangerous plastic ones that harm marine life.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/craft-beer-brewery-creates-an-edible-six-pack-ring-which-fees-not-chokes-marine-wildlife_uk_573db844e4b03f08843e3ee3

attributes.action: Make voting a legal requirement
attributes.background: In Australia most noteablly, but in other countries to, voting in all official elections (local and general elections) is a legal requirement. Punishable under court of law, usually with a hefty fine.
attributes.additional_details: With many local councils registered a 35% or lower turn out rate, democracy is all but dead in this country (cited by BBC) I want to ensure that we get large turnouts for general elections, local elections and national referendums (eg EU). This will have the knock on effect of bring the power back to the public of the UK and reinstating a true reflection of what the nation wants as its governments

attributes.action: Ban GMO crops in the UK
attributes.background:
Ban GMO (Genetically Modified) Crops in the UK because of:
1. its influence on human health is questionable.
2. once any plant is introduced in the ecosystem it is almost impossible to eradicate it
3. Food label does not show GMO content
attributes.additional_details:
Ban GMO (Genetically Modified) Crops in the UK because of:
1. its influence on human health is questionable (see http://www.motherearthnews.com/natural-health/nutrition/gmo-safety-zmgz13amzsto.aspx)
2. once any plant is introduced in the ecosystem it is almost impossible to eradicate it
3. food is not labelled correctly - it is not shown if food does contain the GMOs
4. special pesticides are used to protect GMO crops and they are dangerous to humans and environment

attributes.action: Invest in cleaning up and preventing the pollution in the River Thames
attributes.background: The Thames is an integral natural landmark in London, one of the best there are in the UK. Pollution in recent years has been a rising problem across the world, but in this river alone thousands of animals have died or been poisoned, and the water resource is unused by the public entirely.

attributes.action: Stop the force of adoption from innocent young mums!
attributes.background: I fell in love at a young age like most of us do, it was a confusing time but I though that was it life was perfect, so when I fell pregnant and then found out it was twins! I had my family for life but then because of my age social workers started sniffing around.
attributes.additional_details: I had a good childhood, just my mum and siblings but we had it good  (not having a father around made my decision to keep my babies easier!) I had never even heard of social services until I got pregnant. I got allocated a family nurse  (who befriended me,secretly was against my pregnancy) from there the child snatching plan begun, me and my partner went into a unit together to bring up our children independently , they let me dote over them for a year while secretly finding them a new mum.

attributes.action: Enforce stricter penalties for drivers 'hogging' the middle lane on motorways.
attributes.background: I'm accordance with The Highway Code, 'Rule 264' states that all drivers must keep to the left-hand lane when not overtaking. The Government should consider to enforce this law more stringently and issue with greater frequency the number of penalties to penalties to drivers who commit this offence.
attributes.additional_details:
It is becoming more consistent, with modern driving convention, that the middle lane is being incorrectly used as the primary driving lane. This above all, is dangerous practice and causes delays. It effectively limits 3 lane motorways to the middle and right hand lane when drivers do not use the left hand lane.

The government should consider instructing the Police to give out more penalties to drivers committing this offence. Additionally penalties should be more severe to act as a deterrent.

attributes.action: The UK Government should impose sanctions on Countries that operate 'Tax Havens'
attributes.background:
Tax avoidance through use of 'Tax Havens' is a huge issue, costing our country Billions of pounds. 

The excuse we hear for it is that a lot of it 'complies with the rules' or isn't illegal, because other countries have different laws or practices.

We should take action to encourage they change
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals and companies avoid tax (while we're paying it) by using tax havens, they say until the countries that provide those havens stop, we can't stop it. 

Then put sanctions on those countries! 

The money they help hide takes the care away from our people who need it, stops the potholes being filled in AND means we all pay more tax. If we can put sanctions on countries for hurting their population and enemies, then we can do do for countries allowing practices that hurt Britons.

attributes.action: Debate smoking inside shared buildings and flats. Unavoidable passive smoking.
attributes.background: Neighbours smoking inside shared buildings/ flats is a real issue of  health and quality of life for many families and children. As more flats are built in the UK's towns/ cities it is now more relevant for discussion. Current position is rights of the smoker favoured of a majority of those effected
attributes.additional_details:
Relying on the implementation of a lease alteration for smoking is not practical. It is expensive, complicated and involves all parties being willing to adopt.

The health effects of passive smoking are well documented as are the damage it has on young children.

Home insurance premiums may be proportionately higher as a smoker lives in the building. Heating bills may be higher as those affected open windows to combat the smoke.

Many of the UK's homes are old and cannot be made 'air tight'.

attributes.action: Make disability awareness a regular thing taught in schools
attributes.background:
As a 14 yr old teenager with cerebral palsy who uses a wheelchair I know that bullying can be a regular thing for disabled people.

I believe that something needs to be done therefore we need to teach more young people about disability in order to reduce bullying and ultimately lack of awareness

attributes.action: Allow the public to decide the order private members' bills are debated.
attributes.background: Allow the public to vote on the order private members' bills are debated on the days set aside for such bills. This facility (and the relevant bills) should be advertised and an interface, similar to this one, should allow the public to vote for the bills they want to be debated on the day.
attributes.additional_details: The percentage of votes cast should determine the order the private members' bills are debated and also which bills are debated. A bill will need to receive at least 25% of the votes cast to be debated on a particular day, and debating time should be allocated by the speaker according to the percentage of votes cast for the qualifying bills.

attributes.action: Stop moving the retirement age. If aged 50 plus you can't adapt your finances.
attributes.background: The government should only change the retirement age for those entering the system. People need to know their retirement date will not change for their working life. It is very difficult to plan for retirement when the date constantly increases. Those aged 50 are particularly disadvantaged.
attributes.additional_details: During my working life my retirement age has already increaed  at least twice. Other workers in a similar difficult position are finding it so hard to plan for their retirement when the date keeps moving. Those aged 50 plus are especially hard hit by these changes both emotionally and financially. A person needs to know for certain their retirement age from the day they reach 18 and that date should not be altered, especially not by five or ten years.

attributes.action: Any consideration-wholly or partially-of NHS Professionals must be debated fully
attributes.background: NHS professionals is publicly owned and is said to be running at a profit of 8 million pounds.  Our hospitals rely heavily upon this agency to safely staff our hospitals with key medical staff such as nurses and doctors.  This is yet another branch of our NHS currently being reported as under threat
attributes.additional_details: This report was shared today https://www.rt.com/uk/333270-nhs-professionals-privatized-deloitte/#.VstIPcCmq_k.facebook which is worrying news that NHS professionals may be sold off.  If this organisation is running at a profit of 8 million pounds per year what justification can there be for this?  Surely in the longer term this will cost our NHS more money for the same or similar service and it is an organisation which is crucial to the safe staffing of our hospitals.  Our NHS is important to us

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: In 2012 the Coalition Government raised tuition fees to £9000 a year, which means students now face crippling debt. This shackling debt often lasts decades. Free education is a right not a privilege. We have to act now to take back what's rightfully ours!
attributes.additional_details: Young students eager to better themselves as people are facing crippling debt after they leave university unless they are born of a very wealthy family. This ensures that the wealth stays with the families who have always had it. Worse still is the number of young people denied the chance of university due to their disadvantaged background. Free education is vital if we are to have a country that utilises the most talented rather than the most fortunate. Free education is necessary for equality.

attributes.action: Restrict Rail Franchise Owners paying excessive dividends when performance fails
attributes.background:
Some Train Operating Companies have fallen far short of their Public Performance Measures (PPM).

Simultaneously Franchise Owners - such as the Go Ahead Group - continue to pay material dividends that offer investors an attractive yield (e.g. 4-5%) which is 10 to 20 times the typical savings rate.
attributes.additional_details:
The PPM of the GoVia Thameslink Group (Southern, GEX and TL) is around 70% in 2016 so far - against the target for of around 86%. One in 3 trains is late.

The service that funds their dividends has failed to meet acceptable standards, and annual fare increases continue to be applied which contribute to that dividend.

This petition seeks to apply legislation that forces Franchise Owners to limit dividend distribution when PPM and other measures fall materially, and serially, short of target.

attributes.action: Change the house buying process in England, Wales and NI
attributes.background: A petition to address the requirement of consumer protection when purchasing or selling a property. Minimising financial exposure and risk after price agreement and the subsequent common terms of sale changes; gazumping, gazundering and pulling out. MPs to create safeguards in earlier commitment.

attributes.action: Make appropriate sex education for LGBT+ people mandatory in schools.
attributes.background: We, as young people, have very limited access to sex education in school...so when it comes to sex education regarding LGBT+ people, there is essentially nothing! This needs to change or more than just people's education could be negatively impacted. People's health could be at great risk!
attributes.additional_details: We had to visit specific charities and organisations to receive any information regarding LGBT+ sexual health. This is just not okay as it puts people at risk and creates a separation between peers (solely due to their sexuality/gender).

attributes.action: Support Peoples QE. Reduce private debts, boost savings, rescue the economy.
attributes.background: Public and Private Debts are at an all time high in the United Kingdom.  net unsecured borrowing on credit cards and loans will rise to £662bn by the end of the decade, from £447bn in 2016. The amount of private debt is crippling the economy. We need to reduce debt in the economy.
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing that we reduce private debt through Bond given to all UK Citizens. The bond would be financed throuh QE  money created by the Bank of England. This financial value of the bond ( sat £1000 per person) would be used to either clear existing debts ( as specified) or as a savings bond for people without debt. The policy would reduce debt, increase savings, compensate savers for low interest rates reduce poverty, and help the economy to grow.
